Tucson Prime first replies to Talon while attempting his climb.

" Thank yo=
u Talon, for now, stand by for further instructions..  We will attempt an e=
scape to reduce further risks to our ranks....  Wait a minute...  That's Da=
rkhawk... He - he's calling for help.  Talon, I have to break contact for n=
ow, need to help someone.  I'll call you back, I promise."

He breaks conta=
ct with Talon, hearing Darkhawk's voice.  Night Shift hears it too.

" Sir,=
 you thinkn' what I'm thinkn'?  I mean that little pest has slagged us more=
 than enough times..  But deep down he's one of us."

Tucson nodds.

"Exact=
ly what I was thinking Night Shift.  Change of plans."

He lets go of his i=
nverted spider maneuver as does Night Shift, who both land back on their fe=
et, to follow Dark Hawk's cry for help.  Like cats, as soon as their feet s=
urely touch ground, they follow the sound until they find him, as they keep=
 their regular headlights on for light. Tucson arrives first, kneeling down=
 to Dark Hawk.  Night Shift now approaches as well, to assess the predacon'=
s injuries.

" Before you go nuts on us, we're here ta help not ta hurt ya.=
  It's okay, we're not gonna open fire, we promise."

Tucson knew what was =
happening.  He had an idea all along that Hydras never gave a real scrap ab=
out any of his lackies.  He felt bad for Dark Hawk, he knew that he had bee=
n cast asside like a piece of trash. Instead of resenting him for his animo=
sity toward him, he looks down to the fallen predacon with an air of compas=
sion.

" Hydras may not come for you but, no matter who you are, which fact=
ion you're on, if you need help, I will ALWAYS come to your aid. And it's n=
o lie, it's a PROMISE.  Sure, you did a number on me, but, all things assid=
e, I believe that really wasn't your fault.  Now, don't be alarmed, I'm goi=
ng to lightly touch you to scan for fractures or major damages.  I want you=
 to tell me as soon as I touch something that hurts, so I can get an idea o=
f what needs to be repaired.  Night Shift, support his upper body and try t=
o keep him calm."

Night Shift nodds.  Tucson now looks to Rodimus.

"Hmm, =
still a little dark down here.  Rodimus, could you give me some more light =
please?  I can't quite see if there's any external leakage of fluids due to=
 his fall."

Night Shift could see that the lights were turned up as high a=
s they went.  He couldn't help but interrupt.

"Umm, Sir, they're up as hig=
h as they go..."

Tucson was realizing what was happening.  The power that =
turned him into a Prime could only give him sight temporarilly.  In order t=
o be able to see permanently that damage had to be maunally repaired.  Soon=
, the area was becomming darker and darker.  And this time he was without h=
is transmitter.  It was clear he would need assistance to vacate the area.
=

" The Matrix must have only given me enough reprieve from my disability to=
 get Rodimus recovered..  I've done that, and now..."

Before he could fini=
sh, the light dims and then..  Nothing.  He did not panic though, he was st=
ill a Prime, just a Prime who could not see.

"Night Shift, you'll have to =
take over for me..  Rodimus, here's your test.  Guide me back safely to the=
 Ark, I will help you fight, but you have to be up front and honest with me=
.  Watch my back because even though I hear, I'm without my transmitter, an=
d I am still blind to those beyond my range of normal hearing.  Do this for=
 me, and I will trust you for eternity."

Night Shift takes over, carefully=
 assessing Dark Hawk's injuries.

remember one thing as

Rodimus' hand retracted and in its place was a grappling hook which he

fired upwards, and with a click it latched onto something above. As

t as he could he began to climb out of the hole, while still

e firepower that was coming from above!

felt a blast of heat as several shots came

using him to spin as his shoulder was

n here!" Rodimus grunted as he

ted his main cannon at the Predacons and Decepticons, his

 not to hit them, but to destroy the floor beneath their

 as energy was built up, and then a beam of light and

y was fired from the great cannon muzzle vaporizing

his location as soon as possible."
